feed.title: Mato Baltica | Projects
feed.subtitle: nexus for the critical study of Baltic cinemas and broader regional culture

entry.title: Baltic Cinemas Research Resources
entry.content:
Baltic Cinemas Research Resources

Introduction

Estonia üá™üá™

Film Institutions

  • Estonian Film Institute
  • Film Estonia

Film Archives and Collections

  • Estonian Film Archive
    • Mediateque
    • Virtual Reading Room
  • Tallinn University Media Archive

Databases and VOD platforms

  • Eesti Filmi Andmebaas
  • Arkaader
  • ERR
  • ERR-archive
  • Anthill ‚Äì vast collection of Estonian mostly Soviet era films (interface in Russian)
  • 101 Estonian films (based on the book by Tristan Priim√§gi) on NETIKINO
  • Estonian Animation from Tallinn film
  • Animation from Eesti Joonisfilm
  • Estonian Shorts

Film Festivals

  • Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival (P√ñFF)
    • P√ñFF Shorts
    • Just Film
    • Women‚Äôs Nights Film Festival (N√ñFF)
  • P√§rnu Documentary and Science Film Festival
  • DocPoint Tallinn ‚Äì a satellite of the Helsinki DocPoint festival
  • Tartu Love Film Festival ‚ÄúTartuff‚Äù
  • The Haapsalu Horror & Fantasy Film Festival (H√ïFF)
  • Matsalu Nature Film Festival (MAFF)

Film Museums

  • Estonian Film Museum (Ajaloomuuseum)
  • The National Archives‚Äô permanent exhibition

Film Studios

  • Tallinnfilm ‚Äì dissolved, film restorations and distribution
  • Eesti Telefilm ‚Äì on hold
  • List from Film Institute
  • Eesti Joonisfilm

Film Education

  • Baltic Film, Media and Arts School at Tallinn University
  • Estonian Academy of Arts (EKA)

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Filmmakers Association
  • Documentary Guild
  • Film Directors Guild
  • Screenwriters‚Äô Guild
  • Animation Association
  • Society of Cinematographers
  • The Estonian Association of Audiovisual Authors
  • Film Journalists‚Äô Association
  • Actors‚Äô Union

Film periodicals and publications

  • National Library of Estonia
    • Digar (Digital archive)
  • Teater.Muusika.Kino
  • Sirp
  • Baltic Film Magazine
  • Estonian Film Magazine

Miscellaneous

  • Ministry of Culture
    • Creative Persons and Associations Act
    • Copyright Act
  • The Estonian National Culture Foundation
  • Statistics

Latvia üá±üáª

State Film Institutions

  • National Film Centre of Latvia
  • Ministry of Culture

Film Archives, Collections, and Databases

  • Latvian State Archive of Audiovisual Documents
    • See, Hear Latvia! ‚Äì Digital archive of audiovisual, photo and audio documents of the Latvian State Archives of Audiovisual Documents.
  • Riga Film Museum Archive
  • Filmas.lv -en ‚Äì Rich collection of restored films (mainly from the Soviet era) available worldwide
  • Filmas.lv -lv ‚Äì The Latvian Section provides access to a majority of fiction, documentary, and animated films produced in Latvia. It is accessible from Latvia and partially from Latvian libraries.
  • latfilma.lv ‚Äì The content of this abandoned site hosted by Latvian Filmmakers‚Äô Union was integrated into filmas.lv and the NKC. However, you can still find some original articles by visiting the site via the Web Archive.
  • National Library of Latvia
    • Digital periodicals collection ‚Äì mainly in Latvian and Russian

VOD platforms and streaming services

access from Latvia

  • Tet+
  • LMT Viedtelevƒ´zija
  • Go3

worldwide

  • RePlay ‚Äì Some of the films are geolocked
  • DaFilms ‚Äì Latvian section
  • ArtDocMedia ‚Äì filtered by :produced_in_Latvia
  • Latvian films available to watch for free and Latvian movies on demand ‚Äì Most useful lists of Latvian films are available online. The lists are made and curated by Dita Karauze. Check her other lists‚Äîa thematic collection of Latvian cinema‚Äîusing the hashtag #LVKIno.
  • Latvian experimental film ‚Äì Another Letterboxd list features a curated collection from the Baltic Analog Lab.

Film Festivals

  • Riga International Film Festival ‚Äì successor of ‚ÄúArsenals‚Äù
  • 2ANNAS ‚Äì Riga International Short Film Festival
  • Baltic Sea Documentary Forum
  • ArtDocFest ‚Äì A documentary film festival formerly based in Russia has relocated to Latvia. Their site also hosts a rich digital cinemateque where many films are available, either for free or with a subscription.
  • European Documentary Film Symposiums ‚Äì Active from 1977 until the 2000s, this forum is now attempting a revival at ArtDocFest.
  • [Lielais Kristaps] ‚Äì National Film Award, previously National Film Festival

Film Museums

  • Riga Film Museum

Film Studios

  • Riga Film Studio ‚ÄìFormerly one of the biggest film studios in the USSR, it had an extraordinary documentary branch. Currently, it deals with preservation and digitalization.
  • VFS films ‚Äì produced ‚ÄúThe Jump‚Äù, ‚ÄúBridges of Time‚Äù, ‚ÄúUkrainian Sheriffs‚Äù and many others.
  • Juris Podnieks Studio ‚Äì originally founded by Juris Podnieks, is now headed by Antra Cilinska, documentary filmmaker, producer, editor, Juris‚Äô long-time collaborator
  • GILDE ‚Äì run by Romualdas Pipars and Baiba Urbane
  • Dream Well Studio ‚Äì independent animation production company. Founded by Gints Zilbalodis.
  • Rija Films ‚Äì has a section of its films available on demand
  • Locomotive ‚Äì In addition to film production, the studio conducts outstanding restorations of Latvian film classics
  • List of film production companies and studios at latfima

Film Education

  • National Film School of the Latvian Academy of Culture
  • Baltic Analog Lab film school
  • The Art Academy of Latvia
  • RISEBA

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Filmmakers Union
  • Latvian Guild of Cinematographers
  • Film Producers‚Äô Association
  • Animation Association

Film periodicals and publications

  • Culture Crossroads ‚Äì an international peer-reviewed journal published by the¬†Institute of Arts and Cultural Studies of the Latvian Academy of Culture.
  • Kino Raksti
  • Latvijas arhƒ´vi ‚Äì publishes articles on archives

Miscellaneous

  • Tue Steen M√ºller‚Äôs blog ‚Äì Tue is a legend in the documentary world, known for participating in and writing about many European film festivals. He is also a valued friend of the Latvian documentary film scene. His blog is a wonderful source for news and reviews concerning Latvian documentaries, filmmakers, and events.

Lithuania üá±üáπ

Film Institutions

  • Lithuanian Film Centre
  • Vilnius Film Office
  • Kaunas Film Office
  • Meno Avylis ‚Äì This wonderful film and educational NGO preserves Lithuanian film heritage, among its many other activities.

Film Archives, Databases, and Digital Cinemateques

  • Lithuanian Central State Archives
    • Digital Archive E-Kinas
    • National Library of Lithuania
  • LRT mediateque ‚Äì huge collection of documentaries and TV programs
  • sinemateka.lt ‚Äì Lithuanian films restored by Meno Avilys. The Cinemateques also has a physical collection of films and publications at Go≈°tauto St. 2, Vilnius
  • INFONDAS ‚Äì database and streaming platform for Lithuanian films
  • Lithuanian Shorts

VOD and streaming

  • Kino pavasaris at Telia.lt

Film Festivals

  • Vilnius International Film Festival ‚Äî Kinopavasaris
  • International Vilnius Documentary Film Festival
  • European Film Forum ‚ÄúScanorama‚Äù
  • Vilnius Short Film FEstival
  • IFF ‚ÄúBaltijos banga‚Äù
  • International Experimental Film and Arts Festival ‚ÄúSuspaustas laikas‚Äù
  • Vilnius Queer Film Festival ‚ÄúKreivƒós‚Äù

Film Museums

  • Lithuanian Theatre, Music and Cinema Museum
  • Jonas Mekas Visual Art Center
  • MO Museum ‚Äì ‚Äì mediateque and library
  • National Gallery of Art ‚Äì mediateque and library

Film Studios

  • Lithuanian Film Studios ‚Äì not quite active
  • Nominum ‚Äì founded by Arunas Matelis
  • Studija Kinema ‚Äì founded in 1989 by director Sharunas Bartas
  • More companies ‚Äì Lithuanian Film Industry Guide published by LFC

Film Education

  • National Film School at LMTA
  • Skalvija Film Academy
  • Meno Avilys‚Äô educational programs

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Lithuanian filmmakers union
  • Lithuanian association of cinematographers
  • Independent Producers Association
  • Association of Lithuanian film culture
  • Animation Association
  • Alliance of cinema auteurs

Film periodicals and publications

  • Kinas
  • Literatura ir menas
  • 7md
  • 15min.lt
  • Lituanus
  • Database ‚ÄúLituanistika‚Äù

Other

  • The Baltic Sea Region Film History Conference
  • Baltic Screen Media Review
  • Central and Eastern European Online Library
  • Apparatus ‚Äì journal that deals with film, media and digital cultures of Eastern, Central and South-Eastern Europe
  • Baltic Worlds ‚Äì scholarly journal published by the Centre for Baltic and East European Studies at S√∂dert√∂rn University
  • AABS ‚Äì The Association for the Advancement of Baltic Studies
  • Journal of Baltic Studies
  • KinoKultura ‚Äì publishes articles and reviews on the cinemas of regions and nations, including special issues on Estonia, Latvia, and others.
  • Tuna journal ‚Äì issued by the National Archives of Estonia
  • East European Film Bulletin)
